item.title: Making a turn-based strategy game in C++ in 72 hours
item.description: A turn-based strategy game developed for Ludum Dare 42 game jam in C++ and SFML.

item.title: When the compiler fixes your mistakes
item.description: I have been working on a new feature for my terminal-based application launcher. I want to be able to search for programs and run them from within Emacs using xstarter. In this post, I'll describe a strange experience I have had fixing a bug.

item.title: On the benefits of a text-based user interface
item.description: Modern user interfaces offer stunning graphic styles and impressive visual effects. However, there's a category of applications that is seemingly outdated but yet offers unparalleled productivity and unique experience in interaction with a computer.

item.title: How to set up googletest library from source?
item.description: The following guide provides instructions on how to compile and add googletest to a C++ project. It will use pkg-config to obtain compiler flags and can be used with a build system such as cmake.
